meaning: A knapsack, sometimes mounted on a light frame, but always supported by straps, worn on a person’s back for the purpose of carrying things, especially when hiking, or on a student's back when carrying books.
A type, species, or strain of bacterium.
A distinctive mark, token, sign, emblem or cognizance, worn on one's clothing, as an insignia of some rank, or of the membership of an organization.
example: the badge of a society; the badge of a policeman

meaning: (usually uncountable) Luggage; traveling equipment
example: Please put your baggage in the trunk.

meaning: The act of cooking food by baking.
example: I baked a delicious cherry pie.

meaning: A person who bakes and sells bread, cakes and similar items.
A shop in which bread (and often other baked goods such as cakes) is baked and/or sold.
An accessible structure extending from a building, especially outside a window.
An inflatable buoyant object, often (but not necessarily) round and flexible.
example: the balloon of St. Paul's Cathedral in London

meaning: A large room used for dancing and banquets.
One who conducts the business of banking; one who, individually, or as a member of a company, keeps an establishment for the deposit or loan of money, or for traffic in money, bills of exchange, etc.
One who becomes unable to pay his or her debts; an insolvent person.
example: a bankrupt merchant

meaning: A legally declared or recognized condition of insolvency of a person or organization.
A large celebratory meal; a feast.
A fireplace or pit for grilling food, typically used outdoors and traditionally employing hot charcoal as the heating medium.
example: We cooked our food on the barbecue.

meaning: An agreement between parties concerning the sale of property; or a contract by which one party binds himself to transfer the right to some property for a consideration, and the other party binds himself to receive the property and pay the consideration.
example: At that price, it's not just a bargain, it's a steal.

meaning: A sport common in North America, the Caribbean, and Japan, in which the object is to strike a ball so that one of a nine-person team can run counter-clockwise among four bases, resulting in the scoring of a run. The team with the most runs after termination of play, usually nine innings, wins.
A floor of a building below ground level.
A lightweight container, generally round, open at the top, and tapering toward the bottom.
example: A basket of fake fruit adorned the table.

meaning: A sport in which two opposing teams of five players strive to put a ball through a hoop.
A room containing a shower and/or bathtub, and (typically but not necessarily) a toilet.
example: Most Americans don't know 'WC' and many Brits mock 'bathroom' but almost everyone understands 'toilet' or 'lavatory'.

meaning: A device used to power electric devices, consisting of a set of electrically connected electrochemical or, archaically, electrostatic cells. A single such cell when used by itself.
example: Schoolchildren take a battery of standard tests to measure their progress.

meaning: A reusable software component written in Java.
example: I haven't got a bean.

meaning: In comfortable circumstances as regards property; forehanded.
example: Will it be possible to have access to the room beforehand so that we can set up chairs?

meaning: Someone who is just starting at something, or has only recently started.
example: I'm new to learning Japanese: I'm just a beginner.

meaning: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.
example: They sat on a park bench and tossed bread crumbs to the ducks and pigeons.

meaning: Something that is beneficial.
example: Recycling and reusing garbage can be beneficial to the environment.

meaning: A liquid to consume; a drink, such as tea, coffee, liquor, beer, milk, juice, or soft drinks, usually excluding water.
A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider’s feet upon pedals.
A person's life story, especially one published.
example: There are many biographies of Benjamin Franklin.

meaning: The study of all life or living matter.
example: the biology of the whale

meaning: The anniversary of the day on which someone is born.
A heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting.
example: The baby was cold, so his mother put a blanket over him.

meaning: A type of paper-based reproduction process producing white-on-blue images, used primarily for technical and architecture's drawings, now largely replaced by other technologies.
example: The architect blueprinted the renovation plan once the client had signed off.

meaning: The room where a group of people (especially the board of a company or organization) conducts its meetings
example: Though the new law is popular among the general public, it is hated in the boardroom.

meaning: Something extra that is good; an added benefit.
example: The employee of the week receives a bonus for his excellent work.

meaning: A piece of furniture for the storage and display of books.
A small or thin book.
A store where books are bought and sold.
A small stall for the display and sale of goods.
To carry or convey, literally or figuratively.
example: Judging from the look on his face, he wasn't bearing good news.

meaning: To tie; to confine by any ligature.
example: Just to make the cheese more binding
